Heart’s still burnin’, so I keep singin’ on.
Bridge:
Bills stack high, and the dreams wear thin,
But my soul’s got a fire that won’t give in.
Every scar’s a story, every tear’s a call,
I’ll sing through the silence till I’ve given it all.
Chorus:
Keep singin’ on, let the truth ring true,
Every note’s a fight for the life I pursue.
Through the ache and the doubt, I’ll still raise my song,
Heart’s still burnin’, so I keep singin’ on.
Outro:
So here’s my voice, let it carry me home,
Through empty rooms where my dreams still roam.
No matter how heavy, I’ll carry this dawn,
With love in my heart, I keep singin’ on.

the_songs_that_saved_me.title: The Songs That Saved Me
the_songs_that_saved_me.lyrics:
Verse 1
In a trailer’s shadow, where the silence screamed,
Found a rusted guitar, chased a broken dream.
Johnny’s voice of hurt cut through my pain,
Waylon’s rebel soul kept me sane.

Chorus
Songs that saved me, pullin’ me through,
Truth in the darkness, love that’s true.
From the grave’s cold call to a heart’s soft plea,
These old songs, they’re savin’ me.

Verse 2
Stapleton’s gravel wrapped my scars in grace,
Childers sang the hills where I found my place.
Adele’s fire burned my doubts away,
Each note a light in my lonesome day.

Chorus
Songs that saved me, pullin’ me through,
Truth in the darkness, love that’s true.
From the grave’s cold call to a heart’s soft plea,
These old songs, they’re savin’ me.

Bridge
“Hurt” taught me wounds can sing out loud,
“Cover Me Up” showed love’s the proudest sound.
“O Death” whispered life’s a fleeting flame,
Their truths carved my heart, gave me my name.

Chorus
Songs that saved me, pullin’ me through,
Truth in the darkness, love that’s true.
From the grave’s cold call to a heart’s soft plea,
These old songs, they’re savin’ me.

Outro
Now I strum my truth ‘neath a lonesome sky,
Carryin’ their echoes till the day I die.
Through the pain and love, their voices I see,
These old songs, forever savin’ me.

coal_dust_on_the_lamb.title: Coal Dust on the Lamb
coal_dust_on_the_lamb.lyrics:
(Verse 1)
Sixteen summers bleedin' into fall,
Daddy's shadow stretched across the wall.
His words like whiskey, burnin' down my throat,
Kicked me out to wander, wearin' a thin coat.
Pikeville hollers echoed with my shame,
Innocence a flicker, dyin' in the flame.

(Verse 2)
Found a floor to sleep on, kindness in a stranger's eye,
But the mountain cold seeped in, beneath a starless sky.
Traded school books for a pick and shovel's weight,
Coal dust settled on my dreams, sealin' up their fate.
This broken arm, a constant ache, a twisted memory,
Of a boy who used to dream beneath a dogwood tree.

(Chorus)
Coal dust on the lamb, a stain that won't come clean,
Lost my way back home, a forgotten, faded scene.
These coal-stained hands, they hold the weight of sin,
Prayin' for redemption, hopin' God lets me in.

(Verse 3)
Sunrise paints the mountain ridge, a fiery, bloody hue,
Another day of breakin' back, another debt to accrue.
The fields stretch out before me, endless rows of green,
But all I see is darkness, a fractured, broken scene.
This ain't the life I pictured,  beneath the mountain's gaze,
Just a broken boy, lost in a lonely, hazy maze.

(Bridge)
Mama's hymnals echo, a whisper in the wind,
A memory of comfort, a peace I can't pretend.
Will I ever feel that grace again, that gentle, lovin' hand?
Or am I destined to wander, a ghost in this promised land?

(Chorus)
Coal dust on the lamb, a stain that won't come clean,
Lost my way back home, a forgotten, faded scene.
These coal-stained hands, they hold the weight of sin,
Prayin' for redemption, hopin' God lets me in.

(Outro)
Lord, have mercy, on this coal-stained soul,
Lead me back to the fold, make me whole. 
Make me whole.

roots_torn_slow.title: Roots Torn Slow
roots_torn_slow.lyrics:
Some folks leave like a gust through the pines,
Fast and loud, gone before the night’s decline.
But you left like roots ripped from the ground,
Slow and breakin’, didn’t make a sound.
I stood there watchin’, my heart in my hands,
Pieces of me scattered ‘cross this lonesome land.
(Pre-Chorus)
Every step feels like I’m circlin’ a scar,
A hollow where you were, where you tore me apart.
(Chorus)
Roots torn slow, they don’t just fade away,
They leave a hole that haunts me every day.
I walk like I’m growin’ ‘round the pain,
Plantin’ flowers in the dirt where you remained.
They bloom deeper, they know what I’ve lost,
They choose sunlight, no matter the cost.
(Verse 2)
I used to think love was a fire that burned,
But yours was a weight, a lesson I learned.
Each crack in my soul, it taught me to fight,
To find my own spark in the cold, endless night.
Now I’m sowin’ seeds where the shadows still creep,
Buildin’ a garden from the hurt runnin’ deep.
(Pre-Chorus)
Every bloom’s a battle, every petal’s a prayer,
Proof I’m still standin’, though you ain’t there.
(Chorus)
Roots torn slow, they don’t just fade away,
They leave a hole that haunts me every day.
I walk like I’m growin’ ‘round the pain,
Plantin’ flowers in the dirt where you remained.
They bloom deeper, they know what I’ve lost,
They choose sunlight, no matter the cost.
(Bridge)
I ain’t the girl you left in the dust,
My heart’s got thorns now, forged from the rust.
But these hands still dig, they still reach for the sky,
Turnin’ tears into roses that won’t ever die.
Your leavin’ broke me, but it made me whole,
I found my roots in this stubborn soul.
(Chorus)
Roots torn slow, they don’t just fade away,
They leave a hole that haunts me every day.
I walk like I’m growin’ ‘round the pain,
Plantin’ flowers in the dirt where you remained.
They bloom deeper, they know what I’ve lost,
They choose sunlight, no matter the cost.
(Outro)
Some leave like wind, but you left like stone,
Tore out my roots, but I’m growin’ my own.
These flowers I plant, they’re my heart’s quiet vow,
They bloom deeper… and I’m stronger now.
